at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common

Class LowpassAdapterConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common.LowpassAdapterConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdapterConfiguration

    public class LowpassAdapterConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdapterConfiguration
    A lowpass adapter acts as lowpass filter. LowpassAdapter instances will be triggered by an internal 1 sec time ticker and will generate new output values every second. The output value is estimated by a linear interpolation between the current input value and the last output value. The interpolation factor acts as time constant. An interpolation factor of 0.0 (this is the default) means, that the current input value is sent every second, an interpolation factor of 1.0 means, that the output value will become the input value after infinite time.
    See Also:
    setInterpolationFactor(double)

      • getInterpolationFactor

        public double getInterpolationFactor()

        Returns:
        the interpolation factor

      • setInterpolationFactor

        public void setInterpolationFactor(double interpolationFactor)
        Sets the interpolation factor. The interpolation factor acts as time constant. An interpolation factor of 0.0 (this is the default) means, that the current input value is sent every second, an interpolation factor of 1.0 means, that the output value will become the input value after infinite time.

        Therefore a value update forced from the system timer will cause an output value y, where 

              y = x * e^(-t/T)
        The following interpolation-factors correspond to the time-constants T in seconds 
          T   I-fac         T    I-fac         T    I-fac         T    I-fac         T    I-fac
 ---  -----        ---   -----        ---   -----        ---   -----        ---   -----
 1,0  0,368        5,0   0,819        9,0   0,895       12,5   0,923       16,5   0,941
 1,5  0,513        5,5   0,834        9,5   0,900       13,0   0,926       17,0   0,943
 2,0  0,607        6,0   0,846       10,0   0,905       13,5   0,929       17,5   0,944
 2,5  0,670        6,5   0,857       10,5   0,909       14,0   0,931       18,0   0,946
 3,0  0,717        7,0   0,867       10,5   0,909       14,5   0,933       18,5   0,947
 3,5  0,751        7,5   0,875       11,0   0,913       15,0   0,936       19,0   0,949
 4,0  0,779        8,0   0,882       11,5   0,917       15,5   0,938       19,5   0,950
 4,5  0,801        8,5   0,889       12,0   0,920       16,0   0,939       20,0   0,951
        Parameters:
        interpolationFactor - the new interpolation factor
